document.docAuthor: Stępień, Anna, Błachowiak-Samołyk, Katarzyna & Angel, Martin V.
document.masterDocTitle: A re-description of Discoconchoecia elegans (Sars, 1865) (Ostracoda: Halocyprididae) from high latitudes in the North Atlantic

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A re-description of Discoconchoecia elegans (Sars, 1865) (Ostracoda: Halocyprididae) from high latitudes in the North Atlantic

subSubSection.paragraph:
Conchoecia elegans
Sars, 1865
;
Paraconnchoenia elegans
Poulsen, 1973
Material examined. Lectotype— female, station N- 2 .
Allolectotype— (station N- 2 ).

Description
Female (collected in vicinity of Svalbard )
. Carapace (
Figs 2
A–B; 4 A;
Table 3
). The carapace is 1.9–2.3 mm long, with a height of 0.82–0.98 mm ( 37.3 % ± 2.3 %) (N. B. all values have been standardized by expressing them as percentages of the carapace length (CL) of the individual) and breadth of 0.7 mm ( 31.5 % ± 3.0%). There is a sculpture consisting of a few striae running parallel to ventral margin. The posterior dorsal corner of the right valve bears two spines (
Fig. 2
C), whereas on the left valve there is one small spine at the PDC. The maximum carapace height is at about mid-length. The rostra are similar in length ( 11.7 % ± 0.4 % CL), and similar in length to the incisures, which show some disparity in length - the left incisure is 11.3 % ± 1.5 % CL and the right incisure is 10.0% ± 0.5 % CL. There is a shallow sulcus between the shoulder vaults. The left asymmetrical gland opens anterior to the posterior end of the hinge between the two carapace valves. The gland on the right valve is on the curve of posterior ventral corner.

Second antenna (
Fig. 2
E;
Table 3
). Protopodite length is 47.3 % ± 2.3 % CL and its length: height ratio is 1.5 : 1.7 . Close to the insertion of endopodite there is a patch of fine setules. The first exopodite segment is 12.9 % ± 0.8 % CL and bears a terminal seta on both left and right limbs. Segments 2–9 carry the swimming setae, which are similar in length to protopodite. The combined lengths of segments 2–9 is 6.6 % ± 0.2 % CL. The terminal ninth segment carries three setae; in addition to a swimming seta there are two bare shorter setae. The first endopodite segment (
Fig. 2
G) is 19.6 % length of protopodite and its length: height ratio is 0.90 : 1.26 . It carries two plumose setae (a- and b-seta). The a-seta is about half the length of the b-seta ( 1.3 % ± 0.1 % and 2.4 % ± 0.3 % CL, respectively). The second segment carries five setae, three of which (h–j setae) are similar in length ( 16.6 % ± 2.0% CL). The next two setae are a little longer, f-seta is 19 % CL) and g-setae is 35 % CL.

caption.paragraph: TABLE 3. Limb’s measurements of Lofoten and Svalbard individuals.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 3.
Discoconchoecia elegans
, male, station N-2. A, carapace lateral view; B, carapace ventral view; C, posterior dorsal corner; D, first antenna; E, second antenna; F, endopodite of second antenna; G, mandible; H, maxilla; I, fifth limb; J, sixth limb; K, seventh limb; L, copulatory appendage; M, caudal furca. Scale = 0.1mm.

subSubSection.paragraph:
First antenna (
Fig. 3
D;
Table 3
). The total limb length is 43.3 % ± 0.5 % CL, which is much longer than the female’s. First segment is 51 % the length of total limb, and the second segment is 38 %. Close to the midpoint of the second segment is a seta wraps around the stem of FO (
Fig. 5
A). The c-seta is shorter than in the female ( 6.7 % ± 0.8 % CL), whereas the a- and b-setae are similar in length, and only little shorter than the lengths of the d- and esetae. The e-seta carries the oval pad of hair-like setae which is one of the characteristic features of the genus (
Fig. 5
B). The distance of the distal margin end of the oval pad to end of the seta is 12.0% ± 0.4 % CL. Proximal of the pad plate are inserted several short distally pointing spinules.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 4.
Discoconchoecia elegans
, station N-2. A, female; B, male.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Second antenna (
Fig. 3
E;
Table 3
). The length of the protopodite is 49 % ± 2.1 % and its length: height ratio is 1.6 : 1.8 . First exopodite segment bears row of spines along its ventral margin and row of fine spinules along its dorsal margin. There is seta on the first exopodite segment of both left and right antenna. First endopodite segment (
Fig. 3
F) is about 31 % length of protopodite, its length: height ratio is 1.5 : 1.7 . The c-, d- and e- setae are present on the second segment, but are very short. The f-seta and g-seta are 36.5 % ± 10.9 % CL and 79.6 % ± 3.4 % CL respectively and so much longer than in the female, while h-j setae are 18.2 % ± 0.6 % CL.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 5.
Discoconchoecia elegans
, male, station N-1. A, hook-like seta, B, oval ring on e-seta.
